question:
Consider the following statements:
  1. Central Employment Guarantee Council (CEGC) is the apex body under the MGNREGA
  2. Central Employment Guarantee Council (CEGC) is headed by the Prime Minister of India
  3. The tenure of the Central Employment Guarantee Council (CEGC) members is 2 years
Which among the above statements is/ are correct?
explanation: Central Employment Guarantee Council (CEGC) has been constituted under Mahatma Gandhi NREGA under Section 10(3) (d) of the said act. The tenure of the members is 1 year and Rural Development minister chairs its meeting Not prime minister.
